Content: Lighthouses provide light to ships navigating the ocean.
Lighthouse technology in the late 1800s included curved mirrors, as shown in Figure 1, to direct light toward ships at sea.
Modern lighthouse technology projects light by using lenses like the one shown sin Figure 2.
When a ray of light passes from one medium to another, as shown in Figure 3, it undergoes some changes.
